item.title: Karma add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "Reading is one of the true pleasures of life. In our age of mass culture, when so much that we encounter is abridged,adapted, adulterated, shredded, and boiled down, it is mind-easing and mind-inspiring to sit down privately with a congenial book..." -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: Karma add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Karma add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain
